paper_identification.title: Global Potassium Mass Balances in Agricultural Systems: A Comprehensive Review
paper_identification.primary_soil_k_focus: K mass balance analysis across global agricultural systems, with emphasis on input-output dynamics, soil K depletion patterns, and regional sustainability challenges
paper_identification.temporal_scope: Multi-decadal analysis (1960s-2015), with specific focus on 1980-2015 trends
paper_identification.research_approach: Comprehensive synthesis of global literature, national statistics, and field studies
paper_identification.overall_relevance_assessment: Exceptional - provides the most comprehensive global overview of soil K sustainability patterns

strongest_contributions.evidence: India K omission plots: 13-18 mg/kg exchangeable K decrease, 26-41 mg/kg non-exchangeable K decrease in one rice-wheat cycle
strongest_contributions.significance: Direct measurement of soil K mining rates under no-K conditions

strongest_contributions.evidence: China PNBI K shift: -13.6 kg K2O/ha (1980) to +22.9 kg K2O/ha (2010)
strongest_contributions.significance: Demonstrates reversibility of K depletion through policy intervention

strongest_contributions.evidence: Sub-Saharan Africa: <-15 kg K/ha average PNBI, 20-50 kg K/ha/year losses in high-potential zones
strongest_contributions.significance: Quantifies severe regional K depletion rates

strongest_patterns.evidence: Clear policy-driven reversal from systematic depletion to surplus
strongest_patterns.prediction_value: Demonstrates that national-scale K sustainability is achievable

strongest_patterns.evidence: Declining fertilizer response ratios (13.4 to 3.7 kg grain/kg NPK 1970-2005), continuing negative national K balance
strongest_patterns.prediction_value: Shows consequences of inadequate K management

strongest_patterns.evidence: Even developed systems showing worsening K balance

most_significant.finding: Dramatic country-level differences: China surplus vs India/SSA deficits
most_significant.drivers: Policy differences, economic development stage, fertilizer access

most_significant.finding: Within-country variation by cropping system and agro-ecology
most_significant.example: Australia: largest deficits in sugarcane and low-rainfall grain areas
most_significant.scaling_implications: National averages mask critical sub-regional patterns

crop_system_relationships.evidence: Oil palm, sugarcane, fruits showing highest K removal rates
crop_system_relationships.management_implications: Crop choice fundamentally determines K sustainability

crop_system_relationships.insight: Yield intensification without K intensification = depletion
crop_system_relationships.evidence: Morocco yield response only above 5 t/ha; higher yields = higher K removal
crop_system_relationships.sustainability_warning: Green Revolution success creating K crisis

methodological_strengths.validation: Cross-validation with fertilizer industry data and field studies
methodological_strengths.confidence: Provides robust framework for global comparisons

methodological_strengths.limitation: 10-15% uncertainty in crop K concentration leading to balance calculation errors
methodological_strengths.propagation: Uncertainties compound at national scale aggregation
methodological_strengths.mitigation: Need for improved crop K content databases

question_branches_with_limited_evidence.gap: Limited quantitative probability modeling of future K sustainability
question_branches_with_limited_evidence.paper_contribution: Provides trends but not probabilistic forecasts
Focus on annual/multi-year patterns, less seasonal detail

highest_confidence_mappings: Regional variation documentation (4.x branches) - exceptional coverage
Temporal dynamics identification (2.3-2.6) - robust multi-decadal evidence
Agricultural integration (5.x branches) - strong crop-system relationships
medium_confidence_mappings: Quantitative parameters (1.x branches) - good data but variable precision
Scaling approaches (6.x branches) - good methodology but acknowledged uncertainties
limited_evidence_areas: Probability assessment (3.x branches) - trends identified but probabilistic modeling limited
